title: Workshops
metaDescription: As the world evolves, technology changes ,what works today may not work tomorrow so it is better to stay up-to-date with new technologies and learn how to use them in your daily life .
description:
As the world evolves, technology changes ,what works today may not work tomorrow so it is better to stay up-to-date with new technologies and learn how to use them in your daily life .

Code baker

It is a Training Program for undergraduate students to qualify them in some technical and non-technical tracks.

It is held at the end of the year in the summer and its goal is to qualify students from engineering teams and others to the requirements of the labor market.

Juniors

It is a program based on the "project-based learning" and the survey methodologies within the framework of the continuous development of the educational system.

This applied through a summer camp in the mid-year.

Some examples of tracks of workshops:

  1. Web development
  2. Programming
  3. Embedded Systems
  4. Network
  5. Security
  6. Mobile development

and others..

by the way if you don't use technology in your own world , it won't use you in its world.

title: Group
metaDescription: IEEE Al-Azhar club group is made to share knowledge, experience even Geeks jokes can be posted or shared between all our members.
description:
IEEE Al-Azhar club group is made to share knowledge, experience even Geeks jokes can be posted or shared between all our members.

This group is for:Software Engineers/Developers, Hardware engineers, not just Al-Azhar students, but anyone interested in these markets.

title: Competitions
metaDescription: Raise awareness and emphasizing the importance of problem-solving skills as an essential skill in the software industry
description:
Problem-solving

Raise awareness and emphasizing the importance of problem-solving skills as an essential skill in the software industry, and preparing students of Al-Azhar University to participate in local and international programming competitions.

Open-source

Open source culture and concepts help students, and communities have a better learning experience being free to share their ideas and build on the work of others.

Learning and teaching "the open source way" will better prepare students for their careers.
